page.title: 03MRS HALL'S GARDEN
page.content:
Mrs. Hall's Garden
When Mrs. Laura Hall moved in she hd a big field full of rubble. She got a lorry to carry out the rubble and a tractor to plough it. Then her husband Jerry made a path up to the back of the house. He built a dog's house and a studio. Then he got half of the field planted with potatoes. At the top of the garden they planted lots of flowers and vegetables.
They have blackcurrant, raspberry, gooseberry, plum, pear and apple trees. This garden is beside the shop on the Ravarnette Road. by Andrew McKeown
